0.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

6.text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.

271.text: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.

272.text: Success doesn’t come from what you do occasionally, it comes from what you do consistently.
272.author: Marie Forleo

273.text: Be fearless in the pursuit of what sets your soul on fire.
273.author: Jennifer Lee

274.text: The key to success is to start before you are ready.
274.author: Marie Forleo

275.text: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
275.author: Vince Lombardi

276.text: Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
276.author: Joshua J. Marine

277.text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
277.author: C.S. Lewis

278.text: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
278.author: John D. Rockefeller

279.text: The only thing that stands between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
279.author: Jordan Belfort

280.text: The only time you fail is when you fall down and stay down.
280.author: Stephen Richards

281.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
281.author: Walt Disney

282.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
282.author: William James

283.text: Don’t let the noise of others’ opinions drown out your own inner voice.
283.author: Steve Jobs

284.text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
284.author: Walt Whitman

285.text: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
285.author: Albert Einstein

287.text: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
287.author: Japanese Proverb

288.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
288.author: Confucius

289.text: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
289.author: Roy T. Bennett

290.text: A year from now you may wish you had started today.
290.author: Karen Lamb

291.text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
291.author: Henry David Thoreau

292.text: Don’t limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
292.author: Unknown

293.text: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
293.author: Winston Churchill

294.text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
294.author: Nelson Mandela

295.text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
295.author: Charles Kingsleigh

296.text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
296.author: Robert Collier

297.text: Success doesn't come from what you do occasionally, it comes from what you do consistently.
297.author: Marie Forleo

298.text: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
298.author: Zig Ziglar

299.text: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
299.author: Bo Bennett

300.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
300.author: Theodore Roosevelt

301.text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
301.author: Charles Kingsleigh

302.text: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
302.author: Chris Grosser

303.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
303.author: Theodore Roosevelt

304.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
304.author: Mark Twain

305.text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
305.author: Nelson Mandela

306.text: Everything you can imagine is real.
306.author: Pablo Picasso

307.text: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
307.author: Will Rogers

308.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
308.author: C.S. Lewis

309.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
309.author: Albert Schweitzer

310.text: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
310.author: A.A. Milne

311.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
311.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

312.text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
312.author: Abraham Lincoln

313.text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
313.author: George Eliot

314.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
314.author: Wayne Gretzky

315.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
315.author: Lao Tzu

316.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
316.author: Albert Schweitzer

317.text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
317.author: Alan Kay

318.text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
318.author: Unknown

319.text: If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.
319.author: Unknown

320.text: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
320.author: Zig Ziglar

321.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
321.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

322.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.

323.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
323.author: Steve Jobs

324.text: If you want to achieve greatness, stop asking for permission.
324.author: Unknown

325.text: There are no limits to what you can accomplish, except the limits you place on your own thinking.
325.author: Brian Tracy

326.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.

327.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
